label: Description
value: Panel in shades of brown, gold, purple and green has a pattern of fans, ferns and flowers in an allover pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain weave with supplementary warp patterning (?)

label: Description
value: Hanging of solidly couched silk in shades of brown and gray has a pattern of cloud bands and dragons before Mount Fuji.

label: Description
value: Priest's robe of deep apricot-colored satin brocaded in brilliant flower design in blues, greens, yellow, purple, white, and gilded paper. The technique is known as "kara ori," a brocading with threads floated on the surface. Made in squares and pieces to simulate patches for a Buddhist priest's robe.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: woven

label: Description
value: Large panel of pale green satin patterned with gilded paper pattern of chrysanthemums and leaves. Made in squares to simulate patches. Lined with light brown silk taffeta.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, gilded paper thread Technique: satin weave with supplementary weft (brocading)

label: Description
value: Orange crepe silk fragment, probably from a kimono sleeve, embroidered in silk and gold thread. Pattern of white flower heads with colored foliage.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: satin stitches, couching stitches and knots on crepe foundation

label: Description
value: Fragment in blue and white in a pattern of large-scale floral forms alternating with small-scale star form.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: cut and uncut supplementary warp pile (velvet)

label: Description
value: Narrow panel of cream-colored linen, embroidered at one end with silk and metal paillettes. Large floral spray with zigzag borders.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery with metal on linen foundation Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Border fragment embroidered in a multicolored design of stylized fruit and flowers in a shallow bowl. Zigzag border with dark and light pink dots.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Fragment of a sampler embroidered in polychrome silk showing a basket with flowers and birds, and a standing woman. Geometric border pattern and floral sprays.

label: Description
value: Three panels of narrow lengths of dark blue twill weave silk with a large pattern made of opposing curves, known as tate-waku, woven in gilded paper, framing large open flower heads in white, pale green and gold. Veins in flowers and centers in gold. Material probably intended for a coat.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: twill weave with supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Narrow fragment of linen and twill embroidered in silk and metal. Pattern shows three circular motifs. Outer circle is made up in each case of leaves running counter clockwise.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metallic embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered
Plate IV of "Travail et emploi du Coton" from Diderot's Encyclopia, Vol. I

label: Description
value: Upper register, a man seated, weaving cotton, in a room. Lower register, the loom shown from the side, parts lettered.

label: Credit line
value: Transfer from the Cooper Union Museum Library

label: Description
value: Border with a pattern imitative of Point de Gaze lace has symmetrically-placed medallions that alternate with floral sprays.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace with needle lace inserts

label: Description
value: Squares defined by bead and reel and four lines. Rosettes in reserve on blue in corners. Inside squares five radiating branches with leaves.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Katzenbach and Warren Inc.

label: Description
value: Six-petalled flower shapes outlined in white and filled with picotage and four four-petalled black flowers. Between them, ground seme with black and white diamonds.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Katzenbach and Warren Inc.

label: Description
value: Unpainted ground seme with leafy sprigs in green.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Katzenbach and Warren Inc.

label: Description
value: Imitation of marble or stone, gray on gray, arranged in brick or ashlar block pattern. One full rectangle to the width of the paper. Mortar covered with scrolled green bands or beading, with circular bosses at intersection.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Katzenbach and Warren Inc.

label: Description
value: Rust-red flock border over-printed with black fret design. Edged by Horizontally running honeysuckle in beige and yellow.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed and flocked on handmade paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Katzenbach and Warren Inc.

label: Description
value: Imbricated column, roses and leaves, printed in green and brown in mustard yellow ground, piquote with brown.

label: Provenance
value: Top layer (fourth) on walls of John Jay House in Katonah, New York, built around 1800.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of New York State Department of Education, University of New York

label: Description
value: Anglo-Japanesque sidewall and border: a) Sidewall, center motif of terrace with peacock; surrounding it, Japanese decorative motifs. Original gray ground washed off, leaving wrinkled yellow paper as ground; b) border, portrait medallion and urns between border, on yellow ground.

label: Provenance
value: From a house in Moorefield, West Virginia.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of J.C. Eisenhart Wall Paper Co.
Proposed Convocation Tower, Madison Square (Northeast Corner of Madison Avenue and East 26th Streeet)

label: Description
value: Night scene of a skyscraper consisting of a massed cluster of low tiered sections below culminating in a monumental tower. The structure is illuminated by the city street lights below and streams of light from a chapel- like central section. A white cross is visible at the top of the tower. Pedestrians walk among silhouetted leafless trees below.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Hugh Ferriss; 1964: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Printed panel, entitled "Rooster" with two side views and a bottom piece for a rooster in profile, meant to be cut and sewn into a stuffed toy. Sewing instructions are printed on the upper left corner. "Arnold Print Works, North Adams, MA" is printed on the upper right corner.

value: Paper removed from an extension which might have originally been a covered porch and incorporated as part of the house in 1885.  Located at 331 West 18th Street, New York City.

label: Description
value: Pair of porcelain elephants mounted as candlesticks (parts a and c) with covers (parts b and d).  Standing Elephants with dark gray raised trunks, white tusks; skin painted with short gray lines, denser on backs.  Each elephant on a scrolled gilt bronze base with attached urn-shaped, handled nozzle on a fringed cushion resting on animal's back.  Each circular cover, with finial of curling leaves and tendrils, fits snuggly into nozzle.

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, bronze, gold

label: Description
value: Oblong panel of unbleached linen worked in white linen and colored silks probably as a sampler. At top parts of vine design worked in white; at bottom borders of flowers and foliage in brilliant colors. Unfinished areas are drawn in.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: plain weave embroidered in satin, cut line, French knots and other stitches
